business.headline: Tata Capital eyes India's biggest IPO, seeks $11 billion valuation: ReportLast week, Tata Capital's board approved the listing of up to 230 million shares, including an offer for sale by existing shareholders.

No-cost EMIs: The real cost behind 'zero interest' deals and who benefits? The idea of breaking down a large payment into smaller, interest-free instalments sounds attractive. However, there is more to these schemes than meets the eye.

Bitcoin up by 7%, Cardano jumps by 47% on Trump's US crypto reserves newsAs a result, on March 3, the total crypto market volume witnessed a jump of 197.62% from the previous day, and stood at $206.77 billion.

Paytm under ED lens for FEMA violations, gets Rs 611 crore noticeThe investigation agency said that Paytm failed to follow the rules under the Foreign Exchange Management Act (FEMA) while making an investment in Singapore.
IRCTC and IRFC get 'Navratna' status. Here's what it meansIRCTC has become the 25th Navratna among Central Public Sector Enterprises (CPSEs), while IRFC is now the 26th.
PF UPI withdrawal rules: How to withdraw EPF money via UPI To withdraw your PF money, it is essential to complete the KYC process for your EPF account.
Sensex, Nifty erase early gains to end flat in volatile tradeThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 21,85 points to end at 73,176.25, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 5.40 points to close at 22,119.30.

Paytm shares recover after 4% drop on ED notice over FEMA violationsPaytm earlier informed stock exchanges that it had received a show cause notice from the Enforcement Directorate (ED) on February 28 at 7:27 PM. The notice, dated 27 February, was related to alleged violations of FEMA rules between 2015 and 2019.

Why has Radhika Gupta compared Nifty to Shah Rukh Khan? Details hereNifty has hit its longest losing streak in 29 years, wiping out Rs 90 lakh crore in investor wealth since hitting its peak in September. The Sensex has fallen over 12% since its September 2024 all-time high, when it touched its peak at 85,478.25.

Smallcap and midcap stocks are in free fall. What should investors do?The broader market saw heavy selling pressure last month, dragging the BSE Smallcap index down 15%—its first double-digit monthly decline since the pandemic sell-off—while the Nifty Midcap 100 fell over 10%.

India's manufacturing growth hits 14-month low in February on soft demandThe HSBC final India Manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index, compiled by S&P Global, fell to 56.3 in February - its lowest since December 2023 - from 57.7 in January. A preliminary estimate was much higher at 57.1.

Government looks to enhance PLI scheme to boost exports. Details hereIntroduced in April 2020, the PLI scheme has drawn substantial investment in 14 sectors, attracting original equipment manufacturers (OEMs) and contract manufacturers to scale up production.

Explained: Why Ola Electric shares fell over 5% to hit 52-week low todayIn the past five days, Ola Electric shares have lost more than 9%, and in six months, it has crashed a whopping 52%. Since the start of this year, the stock is down over 37%.

Explained: Why Reliance share price tumbled over 3% today Foreign investors have been aggressively selling Indian equities, dragging down heavyweight stocks like RIL. The company's market value has shrunk as a result, reflecting the broader negative sentiment in the market.

Ola Electric likely to cut over 1,000 jobs amid rising losses: ReportThe job cuts will affect multiple departments, including procurement, fulfilment, customer relations, and charging infrastructure. Ola Electric shares also fell 5% to hit its 52-week low of Rs 54.

How often can taxpayers switch between new and old tax regime? Salaried employees can select their tax regime at the start of each financial year. If no preference is given, employers will deduct tax under the new regime by default.
Sensex, Nifty erases early gains: Why is stock market falling today? By 11:13 AM, the S&P BSE Sensex had fallen 388.70 points to 72,809.40, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 111.50 points to 22,013.30.

Google co-founder shares 'sweet spot' of work hours for employees. Check detailsGoogle co-founder Sergey Brin expressed concern about employees working less than the recommended hours or doing the bare minimum.

Sensex, Nifty open higher as GDP growth boosts sentiment; IT, auto stocks gainThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 142.87 points to 73,340.97, while the NSE Nifty50 added 48.55 points to 22,173.25 as of 9:30 AM.

Crypto market surges $300 billion after Trump names 5 coins for strategic reserveThe total cryptocurrency market has risen about 10%, or more than USD 300 billion, in the hours since Trump's announcement, according to CoinGecko, a cryptocurrency data and analysis company.

Sebi says will challenge order directing case against Madhabi Buch, othersCalling the complainant "frivolous and habitual litigant", Sebi said that it would initiate appropriate legal steps to challenge the special court order to file a case against former chief Madhabi Puri Buch and others.

Adani Group revives US investment plans amid ongoing bribery case: ReportFor now, Adani Group's US footprint remains minimal. Past talks with American companies about petrochemical projects in Texas never led to major deals.

Paytm clarifies FEMA allegations on acquired subsidiaries. Details hereThe company is seeking legal advice and will take necessary steps to resolve the matter through appropriate regulatory processes in line with applicable laws.

US food delivery firm Grubhub lays off 500 employees. Here's whyGrubhub is laying off as many as 500 employees, over 20 per cent of its workforce, following its acquisition by Wonder. The layoffs, spanning all departments, aim to streamline operations as the company integrates with its new parent.

Tuhin Kanta Pandey assumes charge as 11th Sebi chairmanTuhin Kanta Pandey took charge as the 11th Sebi chairman, succeeding Madhabi Puri Buch, who completed her tenure. A former Finance Secretary, Pandey has been appointed for three years.

India to remain fastest growing major economy with 6.5% growth in FY26: IMFIndia's strong economic performance, the IMF said, provides an opportunity for the country to advance critical and challenging structural reforms to realise the ambition of becoming an advanced economy by 2047.

From record highs to a five-month slide: Where are Sensex, Nifty headed?From record highs to relentless losses, Dalal Street's dream run has turned into a nightmare in just a few months. Is there any relief in sight for investors or is there more pain ahead?

Zerodha's Nithin Kamath flags sharp drop in trading activity amid market crashThe stock market fell sharply on Friday, with the Sensex dropping 1,414 points and the Nifty slipping below 22,150. The heavy selling wiped out nearly Rs 9 lakh crore in market value.

Citigroup employee's typo nearly led to $81 trillion blunder. Details hereThe payment was initially overlooked by two employees before a third employee caught it. Citi later reported the incident as a 'near miss' to the Federal Reserve and the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency (OCC).

Don't miss these money deadlines in March 2025: Special FDs, ITR, and more In case you have missed reporting income or made an error in your ITR, you can still fix it. The final deadline for filing an  updated return (ITR-U) is March 31, 2025.

Sensex falls 1,400 points as trade war fears rattle D-Street, Rs 9 lakh crore goneStock market crash: During today's trading session, Dalal Street plunged as Sensex tumbled 1,414 points and Nifty sank below 22,150 amid global trade war fears and foreign sell-off, erasing nearly Rs 9 lakh crore in market value.
GDP grows at 6.2% in Q3 2024-25, up from 5.6% in Q2For the financial year 2023-24, India recorded a real GDP growth rate of 9.2%, marking the highest annual growth in the past 12 years.

Nifty posts longest monthly losing streak in 29 years, over Rs 90 lakh crore goneForeign outflows, weak earnings and global uncertainty have wiped out over Rs 90 lakh crore in investor wealth from  since September 2024, when Nifty hit an all-time high of 26,277.35.

Technicolor India shuts down, over 3,000 employees affected The company currently employs 3,200 people across India, with nearly 3,000 in Bengaluru alone. The sudden move has left several employees in shock.

RuPay Debit Select Card: Check new features effective from April 1, 2025RuPay Debit Select Cardholders can enjoy one complimentary domestic airport lounge visit each quarter and two international lounge visits a year at participating lounges (conditions apply).

India needs tariff cuts, reforms to boost investments: World Bank The World Bank report titled 'Economic Memorandum India' also highlights that for India to become a high-income country by 2047, its per capita income must grow nearly eight times current levels.

What's your best asset in 20s? Not stocks or trading, says Radhika GuptaRadhika Gupta cautioned that young professionals might be focusing on passive income too early. She believes that the best investment in your 20s is not stocks or trading but your talent and time.

Smallcap, midcap indices set for worst month in 5 years. More pain ahead?In 2025 so far, mid-cap stocks have fallen 16%, while small-cap stocks have slumped 21%. In comparison, the benchmark Nifty 50 is down 6.7%.

NPCI introduces UPI Lite's 'Transfer Out' feature. All details hereAll issuer banks and UPI Apps must implement the required changes by March 31, 2025, as mentioned in NPCI's circular dated February 21, 2025

EPFO retains 8.25% interest rate on provident fund deposits for 2024-25In February 2024, the Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) had increased the interest rate on EPF marginally to 8.25 per cent for 2023-24, from 8.15 per cent in 2022-23.

entertainment.headline: Kaam Idhar Udhar Hogaya: YouTuber Ashish Chanchlani on India's Got Latent rowYouTuber Ashish Chanchlani got emotional in his first video after his appearance on comedian Samay Raina's India's Got Latent show.

Maharani 4 teaser: Huma Qureshi returns as Rani Bharti to safeguard BiharActor Huma Qureshi is set to return as Rani Bharti in Maharani Season 4. The makers announced the news with the teaser of the upcoming gripping series.

TV show Tenali Rama set catches fire, shoot haltedA fire broke out on the set of TV show Tenali Rama due to a generator malfunction, halting production. There were no casualties, but the set suffered damage and repairs are underway.

Be Happy: Abhishek Bachchan reunites with Ludo co-actor Inayat in feel-good filmThe trailer of Abhishek Bachchan and Inayat Verma's upcoming dance-drama Be Happy was released today. Directed by Remo D'Souza, the heartfelt film will premiere on Prime Video on March 14.

BTS' J-hope's Seoul concert: New song, fan proposal and special appearance by JinBTS member and rapper J-hope recently held a concert in Seoul which was attended by his close friend and singer Kim Seokjin (Jin). The concert was one big event for the fans as it consisted of many other surprises besides the central performance by the artiste.

Khakee The Bengal Chapter: Jeet and Prosenjit announce release date with fun clipThe next installment of Netflix's critically acclaimed thriller series Khakee, Khakee: The Bengal Chapter will premiere on Netflix in March. The makers of the show announced its release date with a fun video.

Anupamaa actor Sudhanshu Pandey breaks silence on rumoured feud with Rupali GangulyActor Sudhanshu Pandey has addressed the ongoing rumours about a feud with his Anupamaa co-star Rupali Ganguly. In an interview, he clarified the situation and dismissed the speculations.

BRIT Awards 2025: Charli XCX wins album of the year, full winners list hereCharli XCX emerged as a major winner at the Brit Awards 2025, securing multiple accolades. Artists including Sabrina Carpenter and Billie Eilish also took home some of the biggest awards of the night.

Honey Singh's Millionaire Delhi concert: A night of nostalgia, iconic hitsHoney Singh's Delhi concert was packed with nostalgic hits, emotional tributes, surprise guests, and exclusive remixes. The rapper promised bigger things ahead as his Millionaire Tour continues.

Justin Bieber celebrates 31st birthday with family, shares rare pics of son JackPop sensation Justin Bieber marked his 31st birthday with a heartwarming family gathering. He shared rare photos with wife Hailey and their son Jack, capturing the joyous occasion.

Singer Billy Joel stumbles and falls mid-performance, fans say 'that's painful'During a recent performance, legendary musician Billy Joel stumbled and fell onstage, causing fans to worry about his health. The incident has sparked widespread concern and discussions about the artist's well-being.

At sold-out Delhi concert, Honey Singh vows to bring Grammys to India. WatchAt his Delhi concert, Honey Singh wowed fans with his hits and vowed to bring a Grammy to India, inspired by AR Rahman's Oscars win. He also expressed his deep love for Delhi and its people.

Honey Singh set to perform in Delhi, excited fans rush to the venueSinger and rapper Honey Singh is set to perform in Delhi today as part of his ongoing Millionaire India tour. Ahead of the concert, excited fans were seen rushing to the venue as soon as the gates opened.

Honey Singh on online negativity against him: I've been here before YouTube existedSinger and rapper Honey Singh took a dig at those spreading negativity about him through YouTube podcasts. During his Lucknow concert last night, he also spoke about his lifestyle changes.

Shreya Ghoshal's X account hacked: Tried every thing in my capacityRenowned singer Shreya Ghoshal has disclosed that her X account has been compromised since February 13. Despite efforts, she remains unable to access or delete the account.
Splitsvilla 15's Rushali Yadav-Harsh Arora engaged: Just perfectly usSplitsvilla 15 contestants Rushali Yadav and Harsh Arora are now engaged. The couple fell in love on the show.

Nadaaniyan trailer: Ibrahim, Khushi's romance comes with a priceIbrahim Ali Khan is all set to making his acting debut in Nadaaniyan, a love story with a secret deal. Also starring Khushi Kapoor, the film explores romance, ambition, and chaos. It will start streaming on Netflix from March 7.

Honey Singh returns to Delhi for sold-out Millionaire concert: What to expectYo Yo Honey Singh's Millionaire India Tour hits Delhi with a sold-out show, 20,000 fans, top celebs, and a surprise setlist. His parents will attend the concert, making this emotional homecoming extra special.

Honey Singh wishes to team up with Diljit Dosanjh, urges fans to make it happenSinger Honey Singh, currently touring India for his Millionaire India Tour, expressed his desire to collaborate with Diljit Dosanjh again during his recent concert in Lucknow. He urged fans to tag the Peaches singer, hoping to reunite for a new project.

Shabana Azmi reacts to comparisons between Dabba Cartel and Saas, Bahu Aur FlamingoShabana Azmi addressed concerns over comparisons between her Netflix show Dabba Cartel and Dimple Kapadia's Saas, Bahu Aur Flamingo, emphasising the unique elements of each series.

Singer Palash Sen on Diljit's concert culture remark, Euphoria 2.0 and remixesEuphoria's lead vocalist Palash Sen opened up about Diljit Dosanjh's controversial concert culture remark, the rebranding of the band and more in an exclusive interaction with India Today Digital. Sen recently collaborated with Bollywood star Akshay Kumar on the song, Mahakal Chalo.

Alter Ego review: Blackpink's Lisa's album is versatile and powerfulLisa of Blackpink releases her solo album Alter Ego. With a total of 15 songs and several collaborations, the album has a lot to take away from, but Lisa shines the brightest in her solo elements.

Ek Badnaam Aashram 3 part 2 review: Baba Nirala's journey meets a dramatic endReleased-Thu Feb 27, 2025Prakash Jha's most anticipated series, Aashram Season 3 Part 2, is currently streaming on MX Player. The series focusses on Baba Nirala's fate and how his entire kingdom crashes down because of Pammi's quest for revenge.

Dabba Cartel review: Shabana Azmi is a silent lioness in a challenging storyReleased-Fri Feb 28, 2025'Dabba Cartel' is supposed to be a powerful story of five women who team up to run a cartel in Mumbai. But, the Netflix series ends up becoming a mushy pie.

G-Dragon's Übermensch album is out: A long-overdue masterpieceK-pop King G-Dragon is back with a new album after over a decade. Titled Übermensch, the album is a long-overdue masterpiece the fans deserved.

Japanese woman summoned for kissing BTS' Jin without consentA Japanese woman has been summoned by the South Korean police after she kissed BTS member Jin without his consent during a fan event held last summer.

Suzhal The Vortex 2 review: This crime-drama is trapped in the vortex of clichesReleased-Fri Feb 28, 2025Suzhal - The Vortex 2 review: Created by Pushkar and Gayatri, Suzhal - The Vortex 2 is a crime drama that suffers from overstuffed ideas. The show has interesting ideas, but it gets lost in the overstretched screenplay.

Meghan Markle discusses food, music and Korea in new glimpse of 'With Love, Meghan'Meghan Markle and chef Roy Choi bond over food and the culture of South Korea as they discuss Karoake bars and music in the new promo for her Netflix show, 'With Love, Meghan'.

Composer Pritam thanks Mumbai Police for arresting studio theft culpritMusic composer Pritam expressed gratitude towards the Mumbai Police for capturing the suspect involved in a Rs 40 lakh theft from his studio. He praised their efforts in a heartfelt Instagram post.

The Boys 5: Supernatural actors Jensen Ackles, Jared Padalecki to reuniteThe Boys Season 5 will be an exciting reunion as Soldier Boy Jensen Ackles will be joined by his Supernatural co-stars Jared Padalecki and Misha Collins.

Suits LA review: Sass, swag and secrets in a soggy spin-offReleased-Mon Feb 24, 2025'Suits LA' has the flavour of the original 'Suits', but Teddy Black is no Harvey Spector, and you will be reminded of it, despite all the pizazz in the show.

Oscar-nominated Savan Kotecha to find India's first global boy bandSavan Kotecha is launching a nationwide hunt for India's first global boy band. Partnering with Universal Music, he aims to build a teen pop economy and create Indian stars for the world stage.

Undercover High School review: Korean 'Main Hoon Na' with more thrillsReleased-Fri Feb 21, 2025Undercover High School review: It is a thrilling Korean series blending action and comedy, reminiscent of 'Main Hoon Na', where a disgraced spy navigates high school challenges while on a mission to find missing gold.

O Saathi Re: Imtiaz Ali's Netflix series is a modern story with a vintage heartNetflix has released the first look of its new series O Saathi Re, starring Avinash Tiwary, Aditi Rao Hydari, and Arjun Rampal. The series, directed by Arif Ali, will be an 'ode to vintage love in modern times'.

Prajakta Koli hilariously dances to 'Mere Husband Mujhko Piyar…' at sangeet. WatchPrajakta Koli danced to Mere Husband Mujhko Piyar Nahin Karte at her sangeet, leaving guests in splits. She married Vrishank Khanal in Karjat on February 25.

Vijay Yesudas reacts to fake news about father Yesudas's hospitalisationReports were rife that playback singer Yesudas was hospitalised in Chennai due to age-related illness. His son and playback singer Vijay Yesudas exclusively spoke to India Today and shut down the rumours.

Sex Education actor Alexander Westwood jailed for 15 years for sex offencesSex Education actor Alexander Westwood received a 15-year prison sentence for multiple sex offenses. The case has captured widespread media attention due to Westwood's role in the popular Netflix show.

Aashram 3 Part 1 ending explained: Will Pammi's revenge end Baba Nirala's reign?With Aashram Season 3 Part 2 releasing on February 27, let us take a look at how the season ended on a cliffhanger with Baba Nirala's misuse of power and a change in dynamics.

Amit Trivedi says Jasleen Royal's opening act for Coldplay was 'unfortunate'Amit Trivedi, in an interview with India Today Digital, discussed the controversy over Jasleen Royal's opening act for Coldplay's India tour and whether it would impact on the image of Indian artists.

Rapper Kanye West trying to save marriage with Bianca Censori: ReportKanye West is reportedly trying to prevent his marriage with Bianca Censori from ending. An insider reveals that Bianca is considering divorce, and Kanye is panicking.

general news.headline: Body shaming Rohit Sharma pathetic: Minister slams Congress, Trinamool leadersThe Sports Minister's sharp rebuke came hours after Mohamed called Rohit Sharma "fat for a sportsperson" and the "most unimpressive" captain in India's history. Saugata Roy said he completely agreed with her.
One killed, many injured as car rams crowd in Germany's MannheimA car has driven into a crowd of people in the Western German city of Mannheim, killing one person and causing many casualties.
These oversmart people: Supreme Court warns Samay Raina over remarks in CanadaYouTuber Samay Raina had joked about the 'India's Got Latent' controversy during his show in Canada in February.

HAL's 3-week timeline ends, no breakthrough on fate of grounded Dhruv choppersA fleet of 300 Dhruv Advanced Light Helicopters (ALH) has been grounded since January after a crash, and defence experts have raised concerns about their operational reliability.

No one-size-fits-all in cricket: Do players need to fit the mould?Cricket has long accommodated players of all body types, with many stocky cricketers excelling at the highest level. Despite evolving fitness standards, the sport remains unique in its ability to embrace diverse physiques.

Shahzadi Khan, UP woman on death row in UAE, was executed on Feb 15: GovernmentA 33-year-old woman from Banda, Uttar Pradesh, was sentenced to death in the UAE for the death of a four-month-old child under her care following a vaccination.

Military aid to Israel, cold shoulder to Ukraine: Trump's two-front strategyWhile Trump has bent over backwards to expedite delivery of military aid to Israel in its war against Hamas, it has adopted a transactional approach with Ukraine in exchange for security guarantees.

Why a 50-year-old pact with Sri Lanka is being blamed for arrests of IndiansThe Indo-Sri Lankan Maritime Boundary Agreement of 1974, which drew an international maritime boundary between the two nations and ceded Katchatheevu Island to Colombo, is being referred to again. Tamil Nadu Governor RN Ravi questioned the pact's impact on India's territorial and fishing rights after fishermen in the state started an indefinite protest over the arrest of 32 of their colleagues by Sri Lanka.

Why Mamata Banerjee warned of indefinite dharna against Election Commission'Won't let outsiders occupy Bengal,' the Trinamool Congress chief has said, alleging voter list manipulation by the BJP with the Election Commission's 'help'

Supreme Court allows Ranveer Allahbadia to resume podcast. Conditions applyThe Supreme Court came down heavily on Ranveer Allahbadia, saying that freedom of speech has its limitations, observing that using foul language is not humour.
Forget the gowns, men's fashion was more fun at the Oscars 2025With bold brooches and unique ties, men's fashion took a playful turn at the Oscars 2025.

No-cost EMIs: The real cost behind 'zero interest' deals and who benefits? The idea of breaking down a large payment into smaller, interest-free instalments sounds attractive. However, there is more to these schemes than meets the eye.

Paracetamol during pregnancy linked to ADHD in childrenA new study found pregnant women who used acetaminophen, or paracetamol, later gave birth to children, more than three times as likely to receive an ADHD diagnosis.
Satellite reveals how Prayagraj changed in a month to host MahakumbhSatellite images from the Copernicus Sentinel-2 mission reveal the transformation of the area.
Case against IIT Baba over ganja possession, he claims it was prasadIIT baba Abhay Singh, who became popular during Maha Kumbh mela, was detained after he was found in possession of ganja in Jaipur.

Anand Mahindra's appreciation post for Assam's 'steel-willed' Binita ChhetryBinita Chhetry, 8, made headlines for her exceptional dance performance on Britain's Got Talent, earning a standing ovation from both the judges and the audience.

What's next for Akash Anand after his sudden fall from Mayawati's grace?Sources close to Akash Anand revealed that the signs had been clear a week ago, as Mayawati was determined to distance her nephew from the party, believing he was under the influence of his in-laws.

In Ranveer Allahbadia case, Supreme Court's big remark on content regulationThe Supreme Court directed the Centre to suggest some regulations for content on social media, but without impinging on the fundamental right of free speech and expression.

Oscar 2025 full winners list: Best film Anora dominates 97th Academy AwardsThe 97th Academy Awards have wrapped up as of March 3 in EST (March 4 in IST). Sean Baker's Anora took home 5 top honours of the night including Best Picture and Best Actress.

Man claims he got 111 dating matches at Bengaluru airport. Internet has questionsIn a now-viral post on X, a man shared a screenshot which appeared to be from Tinder or Bumble, showing a "Chats" section with "Your matches" prominently displaying the number 111.

IPL 2025: Ajinkya Rahane to lead KKR, Venkatesh Iyer named vice-captainIPL 2025: Defending champions KKR have announced that Ajinkya Rahane will be their captain for the upcoming 2025 season on March 3. Rahane is back at KKR for his second stint and Venkatesh Iyer will; serve as his deputy.

DMK MP slams Chennai airport for no Tamil magazines amid Hindi imposition rowDMK MP P Wilson criticised the Chennai airport for having no Tamil magazines, linking it to Hindi imposition. He called on authorities to respect regional languages in airports.

Have babies immediately: MK Stalin's advice to Tamil people amid delimitation rowTamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin urged people to have children immediately, warning that population-based delimitation could reduce the state's parliamentary representation due to its success in family planning.

Suspect had affair with Congress worker, killed her due to extortion: SourcesThe accused, Sachin, was arrested in Delhi on Monday, two days after Himani's body was found stuffed in a suitcase near a bus stand in Rohtak.

Amitabh Bachchan praised my work in Kalki 2898 AD: Costume designerAce make-up artist Preetisheel Singh D'Souza opened up about working with Amitabh Bachchan on Kalki 2898 AD. In an exclusive interview with India Today Digital, she said the megastar praised her work.

R Madhavan addresses rumours about chatting with young girls on InstagramR Madhavan recently reacted to claims that he often replies to young girls on social media. The actor said how simple reactions to fans can often be misinterpreted.

Sandeep Vanga reveals Ranbir's nude scene in Animal was shot without prostheticsDirector Sandeep Reddy Vanga shared insights on filming a bold scene in Animal with Ranbir Kapoor. He said that the actor agreed to shoot the scene without prosthetics.

Kieran Culkin reminds wife of Emmy speech, fourth baby after Oscar winKieran Culkin reminded his wife, Jazz Charton, about his epic Emmy speech and jokingly talked about baby plans on the Oscar stage. He won Best Supporting Actor for A Real Pain.

sports.headline: FIFA lifts ban on Pakistan Football Federation after constitutional changesFIFA has lifted the suspension on the Pakistan Football Federation (PFF) after it made the necessary constitutional changes to ensure smooth governance of the sport in the country.

No one-size-fits-all in cricket: Do players need to fit the mould?Cricket has long accommodated players of all body types, with many stocky cricketers excelling at the highest level. Despite evolving fitness standards, the sport remains unique in its ability to embrace diverse physiques.

Rishabh Pant nominated for Laureus World Comeback of the Year award India wicketkeeper batter Rishabh Pant has been nominated for the prestigious Laureus Sports Awards 2025 under 'Comeback of the Year' category. Pant made a remarkable comeback to the cricket pitch following a year-long absence after surviving a car crash.

Body-shaming Rohit Sharma is absolutely pathetic: Venkatesh PrasadFormer India cricketer Venkatesh Prasad has extended support to Rohit Sharma after derogatory remarks directed towards the India skipper by Congress National Spokesperson Shama Mohamed.

India vs Australia, all you need to know: Dubai pitch report, live streamingIndia and Australia are all set to renew their rivalry in Dubai as both teams battle it out for a place in the final of the Champions Trophy 2025. India and Australia enter the contest unbeaten as Rohit Sharma and his men have won all their matches so far.

Added drive to beat Australia after World Cup flopshow? Rohit Sharma respondsIndia captain Rohit Sharma admitted that there will be nervy moments for the team in the semi-final clash against Australia in the ICC Champions Trophy 2025. However, the captain said that they would focus more on their game instead of the opposition.

Despite Varun heroics, Rohit Sharma unsure of India using 4 spinners in semisIndia captain Rohit Sharma said that they're unsure about using four spinners in the semi-final against Australia on March 4, despite Varun Chakravarthy's brilliance with the ball against New Zealand.

What made India select Varun Chakravarthy over Jaiswal? Rohit Sharma revealsIndia captain Rohit Sharma revealed the reason behind selecting Varun Chakravarthy over Yashasvi Jaiswal in the squad for the Champions Trophy 2025. Chakravarthy picked up a five-wicket haul in his first outing of the tournament.

IPL 2025: Ajinkya Rahane to lead KKR, Venkatesh Iyer named vice-captainIPL 2025: Defending champions KKR have announced that Ajinkya Rahane will be their captain for the upcoming 2025 season on March 3. Rahane is back at KKR for his second stint and Venkatesh Iyer will; serve as his deputy.

Dubai is not our home: Rohit Sharma dismisses unfair advantage criticism Speaking to the press ahead of India's semi-final against Australia, captain Rohit Sharma said the Men in Blue playing all their games in Dubai is not giving them any kind of advantage. India remained unbeaten in the group stage, beating New Zealand, Pakistan and Bangladesh.

Rohit Sharma is fit: BCCI hits back at 'derogatory' fat-shaming comments BCCI secretary Devajit Saikia and vice-president Rajeev Shukla defended Rohit Sharma, asserting that the India captain is among the team's fittest cricketers. The cricket board strongly condemned a post by Congress National Spokesperson Shama Mohamed that fat-shamed Rohit.

Chakravarthy picked up a five-wicket haul in his first outing of the tournament.

IPL 2025: Ajinkya Rahane to lead KKR, Venkatesh Iyer named vice-captainIPL 2025: Defending champions KKR have announced that Ajinkya Rahane will be their captain for the upcoming 2025 season on March 3. Rahane is back at KKR for his second stint and Venkatesh Iyer will; serve as his deputy.

India remained unbeaten in the group stage, beating New Zealand, Pakistan and Bangladesh.

The cricket board strongly condemned a post by Congress National Spokesperson Shama Mohamed that fat-shamed Rohit.

What is Varun Chakravarthy's 'magic portion?' Harbhajan Singh's interesting takeHarbhajan Singh feels that the 'magic portion' in Varun Chakravarthy's bowling is due to the fact that he hasn't played a lot of international cricket. Varun picked up 5 wickets against New Zealand on Sunday, March 2.

Axar Patel relishing promoted batting role: Can do well with confidence Axar Patel credited his improved batting confidence to his promoted position in India's lineup, which allowed him to play freely. His crucial 42-run knock against New Zealand proved vital in India's unbeaten Champions Trophy group-stage campaign.

Playing Varun unbelievably good decision from Rohit-Gambhir: R AshwinRavichandran Ashwin praised Rohit Sharma and Gautam Gambhir for backing Varun Chakravarthy against New Zealand. He highlighted how Varun's five-wicket haul could be a game-changer for India's Champions Trophy semi-final against Australia on March 4 in Dubai.

India will be favourites vs Australia in semi-final on Dubai track: GavaskarSunil Gavaskar feels that India will be the favourites against Australia in the semi-final of the Champions Trophy 2025 as they're playing in Dubai. India continued their fine form in Dubai with another win over New Zealand.

Want to see big hundred from Shreyas Iyer in semi-final vs Australia: S SreesanthFormer India pacer S. Sreesanth has said that he wants to see a big hundred from Shreyas Iyer in India's semi-final against Australia in Dubai in the Champions Trophy 2025. Shreyas is in fine form for India during the Champions Trophy.

Why is the Champions Trophy venue setup getting so chaotic?South Africa and Australia's early travel to Dubai before their semi-final opponents and venue were confirmed has sparked criticism on the ICC's handling of the Champions Trophy match distribution, especially after the pre-tournament drama involving India and Pakistan.

Definitely planned out, not luck: Varun Chakravarthy on 5 for 42 vs New ZealandVarun Chakravarthy has claimed that all the wickets he took in the match against New Zealand were planned out and not down to luck. Varun's 5 for 42 did feature Willo Young chopping on to the stumps and Michael Bracewell not reviewing a call that would have seen him extend his time at the crease.

Shreyas Iyer on Indian team comeback after whirlwind 1.5 years: It's you vs youShreyas Iyer opened up on the mantra he followed during the last one and a half years, which were filled with highs and lows for him as he established himself as a starter in the Indian team lineup once again. Shreyas continued his fine run of form in the Champions Trophy.

Ganguly hails India favourites for Champions Trophy: Can defeat anyoneSourav Ganguly backed India to beat any opponent in the Champions Trophy after their dominant win over New Zealand. With an unbeaten group-stage run, India now faces Australia in the semi-final as strong title favourites.

IND vs NZ | Varun Chakravarthy elated with Dubai redemption: Looks good right nowVarun Chakravarthy was elated with his performance in Dubai against New Zealand in the Champions Trophy on Sunday, March 2. Varun picked up a brilliant 5-wicket haul against New Zealand in Dubai.

Australia name Cooper Connolly as injured Matthew Short's replacementAustralia have named Connor Connolly as Matthew Short's replacement for the Champions Trophy semi-final against India. Short suffered a calf injury against Afghanistan, ruling him out of the tournament, while Connolly's all-round abilities add balance to the squad.

I was an architect, wanted to make movies: Varun exorcises demons of DubaiChampions Trophy: India spinner Varun Chakravarthy buried the ghosts of Dubai with a sensational spell of 5/42 against New Zealand on Sunday. After winning the player of the match award, Varun opened up on his unusual journey to international cricket.

Shreyas Iyer should finally get the attention he deserves: Robin UthappaFormer India cricketer Robin Uthappa said that Shreyas Iyer should get the attention he deserves following his match-winning innings against New Zealand in the ICC Champions Trophy 2025.

Cracks to craftsmanship: Varun Chakravarthy redesigns his Dubai storyIndia vs New Zealand: Dubai was once where Varun Chakravarthy's international career hit its lowest point. Nearly four years later, he returned to the same ground, taking a five-wicket haul in the Champions Trophy, thereby engineering the downfall of New Zealand on Sunday, March 02.

Virat Kohli hits 'SIU', touches Axar's feet in hilarious anticsChampions Trophy: Virat Kohli touched Axar Patel's feet after the spinner dismissed the dangerous Kane Williamson in India's group-stage match against New Zealand. The hilarious moment went viral on social media on Sunday.

Sunil Gavaskar, speaking to india Today, backed his selection for the semi-final, saying Hardik Pandya as the second seamer is a good enough option for India.

4 spinners is the way to go forward in Dubai: Harbhajan SinghChampions Trophy: Former India spinner Harbhajan Singh has said that the Men in Blue should play 4 spinners on the Dubai pitch going forward. Harbhajan's comments came after India defended a total of 249 runs and won the game by 44 runs.

Varun Chakravarthy gives captain a good headache, Ravi Shastri backs him for semisChampions Trophy 2025: While captain Rohit Sharma admitted that India have a healthy headache before the semi-final, Ravi Shastri backed Varun Chakravarthy to feature in the XI for their semi-final against Australia.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
